thread.title: Bret Harte sophomores win Woodward Invite races
thread.title_full: Bret Harte sophomores win Woodward Invite races

author: Enterprise report
title: Bret Harte sophomores win Woodward Invite races
text:
Bret Harte sophomores win Woodward Invite races Enterprise report Comments 
OAKDALE – Bret Harte High School sophomores Connor Landis and Kaela Dishion finished first in their respective varsity cross country races at Wednesday’s Woodward Invitational at Woodward Reservoir. 
Landis posted the overall top time of the meet by finishing in 17 minutes, 15 seconds, while Dishion was first in the varsity girls’ race in 19:34. 
Dishion’s individual victory helped lead the Bret Harte girls to a first-place team finish out of 15 schools. Also in the varsity girls’ race for Bret Harte, junior Sarahi Terrones was fourth in 22:12 and junior Alyssa Schaffer was ninth in 23:07. 
The Bret Harte varsity boys placed fourth at the meet. 
In the JV boys’ race for Bret Harte, Ryan Heryford was second in 21:54. In the frosh boys’ 2-mile race for Bret Harte, Nate Schaffer was second in 13:33. In the frosh girls’ 2-mile race, Sammie Franck was second in 15:37 for the Bullfrogs. 
Boys soccer 
Bret Harte 2, Sonora 1 
SONORA – Senior Kevin Gonzalez assisted a ball to junior Miguel Barboza, who scored a goal in tight against the base of the goalie post for the first score of Tuesday’s road win for the Bullfrogs (3-8-1, 2-3-1 MLL). After Sonora tied the game in the second half, a free kick by senior Pancho Munoz was headed by senior Malcolm Klass for the winning goal. 
“The difference was that we were able to capitalize on two of the few scoring opportunities we had,” said Bret Harte coach Francisco Munoz. 
Linden 5, Calaveras 0 
Tuesday in San Andreas, the Lions got out to a 1-0 advantage and scored two more goals in the final four minutes before halftime against the Redskins (1-7, 1-4 Mother Lode League). 
Girls golf 
Bret Harte 200, Linden 230 
Junior Hannah Ellsworth birdied holes 6 and 8 and shot the match low with a 40 at Greenhorn Creek Tuesday. Also for Bret Harte (6-3 Valley Foothill League North), sophomore Nicole Ayala shot a 47; freshman Elizabeth Kristoff shot a 54; and sophomore Kellie Krpan shot a 57. 
Ripon 155, Calaveras 192 
RIPON – Senior Summer Schulze shot a 41 to lead the Redskins (2-8 VFL North) in Tuesday‘s loss. Also for Calaveras, junior Colleen Inocencio shot a 44; sophomore Breanna Dunn shot a 51; and senior Kaylyn Hedstrom shot a 56. 
Girls volleyball 
Sonora 3, Bret Harte 0 
SONORA – The unbeaten Wildcats beat the Bullfrogs 25-13, 25-5, 25-12 Tuesday. Sophomore Katie Juarez led the Bullfrogs (15-6, 3-2) in kills with nine and added an ace and 11 digs. Also for Bret Harte, junior Christine Lora had 17 digs and an assist and junior Addison Stafford had 11 assists. 
JV boys soccer 
Bret Harte 4, Sonora 1 
SONORA – A Joe Young goal hit the back of the net in the first few minutes of the game Tuesday and Christian Medrano scored on a rebound inside the box shortly after for the Bullfrogs. Ernesto Lopez and Ryan Barnett scored second-half goals for Bret Harte. 
Linden 6, Calaveras 1 
Kyle Alfred scored the lone goal for the Redskins (4-1 MLL) Tuesday. Tags
